intro: Piriqueta emasensis, commonly known as the Emas piriqueta, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are ovate with serrated edges. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded areas of the understory in forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
